alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 4:18PM EDT until June 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in north central North Carolina, Caswell and Rockingham. In south central Virginia, City of Danville and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain producing thunderstorms which prompted the advisory have exited the area. Minor flooding is still expected as runoff from these earlier rains collect in streams, ditches, and creeks. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the west side of the City of Danville, south to around the North Carolina border with 1 to 2 inches common across the rest of the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Childress Creek, Buckhorn Branch, Banister River, Dan River and Cane Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danville... Mayfield... Providence... Westover Hills... Pelham... Gatewood... Swansonville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
